"}, {"content": "Undetermined

It is unfair and inaccurate to make assumptions about who can hold together a long-term relationship based on mental illness. Both individuals have their own unique circumstances and abilities that are not defined by their diagnosis of schizophrenia or any other mental health condition. Mental illness does not solely determine one's capacity for maintaining relationships; factors such as personal values, communication skills, emotional intelligence, and support systems play significant roles.
